column4: i've installed xubuntu-desktop on ubuntu how to remove gnome nicely?
i've installed xubuntu-desktop on ubuntu how to remove gnome nicely? 10.10 here
remove "ubuntu-desktop" then run "sudo apt-get autoremove"
i still see gnome-power-applet running
xfce uses some gnome components, if you really want to get rid of all of them, run "sudo apt-get remove gnome-*", and "sudo apt-get autoremove" again
i have two power managers xfce and gnome how can i uninstall gnome one?
the gnome one is called gnome-power-manager, you can remove this package
both power managers are running i don't want that to happen with other programs too what to do?
as I said, if you want to remove all gnome components, "sudo apt-get remove gnome-*"
should i also add in && install xubuntu-desktop?
you already installed it, right ? if so, no
you told me xfce uses some gnome packages
well it *can* use some gnome components : they appear in recommended packages, but not in dependencies
when i do remove gnome-* it tells me new packages of KDE will be installed! why?
probably because some installed packages depend on either a package from gnome or one from kde; as you're forcing to uninstall gnome packages, it will install the depency from kde
which one would be better?
dependency from kde or gnome?
either one should work just as fine
is there command which leaves the dependecy alone and only remove 'extra' gnome stuff?
I can't find such an option
